I EXPLAINED THAT THE NEAREST SERVICE CENTER WAS ST LOUIS MO  WHICH HAPPENS TO BE OVER 100 MILES AWAY FROM MY HOME. TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 MERCEDES-BENZ SPRINTER 2500 EQUIPPED WITH GOODYEAR WRANGLER HT TIRES, SIZE: LT215/85R16. WHILE DRIVING AT AN UNKNOWN SPEED ON THE HIGHWAY, THE TWO FRONT TIRES BLEW OUT. LATER ON THE SAME DAY, THE REAR TIRES BLEW OUT. THERE WAS TREAD SEPARATION ON EACH TIRE. TWO OF THE TIRES WERE SHIPPED TO NEW JERSEY. THE CONTACT DROVE TO FT. LAUDERDALE TO A TIRE MANUFACTURER AND PURCHASED TWO NEW TIRES. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURES. THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN. THE TIRE AND VEHICLE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 60,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 MERCEDES-BENZ SPRINTER 2500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE ABRUPTLY DECELERATED WHILE THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL WAS DEPRESSED. THE FAILURE OCCURRED NUMEROUS TIMES WHILE DRIVING VARIOUS SPEEDS. WHEN THE FAILURE OCCURRED, THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT ACCELERATE PAST 30 MPH. THE CONTACT ALSO STATED THAT THE CHECK ENGINE INDICATOR REMAINED ILLUMINATED AND THERE WAS A WARNING THAT THE DIESEL PUMP PREHEATING SYSTEM WAS MALFUNCTIONING. THE CONTACT PLACED THE GEAR INTO NEUTRAL, AND TURNED OFF AND RESTARTED THE VEHICLE TO BRING THE ENGINE BACK TO NORMAL FUNCTION. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHO REPLACED THE DIESEL PUMP, CATALYTIC CONVERTER, AIR COMBUSTIBLE SENSORS, WATER SENSOR FILTER, AND COMPUTER; HOWEVER, THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT CONTACTED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 180,000.

I OWN A 2010 MERCEDES BENZ SPRINTER PASSENGER VAN (2500).  I PURCHASED IT USED IN AUGUST 2014.  THE DEALER I PURCHASED IT FROM INFORMED ME THAT THEY WERE FIXING A LEAK IN THE REAR AIR CONDITIONER. IN JANUARY, 2015 AFTER A SIGNIFICANT SNOWSTORM AND A FREEZE MY AIR CONDITIONING UNIT STARTED LEAKING.  IT ONLY LEAKS DURING A RAIN STORM, BUT IT IS DUE TO THE SEAL THAT IS BETWEEN THE AIR-CONDITIONER AND ROOF OF THE VAN WHICH HAS BEEN TORN.      I UNDERSTAND THAT THIS IS A PROBLEM IN NEARLY ALL SPRINTER MODELS.  THIS POSES A SAFETY CONCERN FOR MY PASSENGERS AND IS A HUGE INCONVENIENCE DURING THE RAINY SEASON.  MERCEDES BENZ NEEDS TO RE-CALL ALL SPRINTERS AND FIX THE DESIGN OF THE ROOF-TOP AIR CONDITIONERS.  *TR

OUR 2010 MERCEDES-BENZ (MB) 2500 SPRINTER VAN AT 57,000 HAD A CHECK ENGINE LIGHT TURN ON. WE TOOK IT TO THE DEALER AND THEY REST THE COMPUTER AND TOOK IT FOR A TEST DRIVE. UPON RETURNING FROM THE TEST DRIVE THEY TOLD US EVERYTHING WAS FINE. TWO DAYS LATER THE LIGHT TURNED ON AGAIN AND THE MOTOR RUNS ROUGH. I TOOK IT BACK INTO THE DEALER AND THE NEXT DAY THEY SAID MY PROBLEM WAS A SENSOR IN THE ADBLUE TANK. TO FIX THE PROBLEM THE TANK, SENSOR AND WIRING HARNESS MUST BE REPLACED AT A COST OF $2200.00. ADBLUE IS THE NAME FOR THE MB DIESEL EXHAUST AFTER TREATMENT SYSTEM THAT INJECTS DEF TO INTO THE EXHAUST. MB HAS ALREADY ISSUED A SERVICE CAMPAIGN FOR A SIMILAR ISSUE. THAT NUMBER OF THAT SERVICE CAMPAIGN IS 201009005. WHEN I CALLED MD @ 1-877-762-8267 THEY LOOKED INTO MY PROBLEM AND TOLD ME THAT ALL THOUGH MY PROBLEM WAS SIMILAR TO THE ONE IN THE PREVIOUS SERVICE CAMPAIGN MY ISSUE IS NOT COVERED BY IT. MY ISSUE IS THAT THE ENGINE HAS A 5YEAR 100,000 MILE WARRANTY AND THIS IS AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE ENGINE; BUT IT IS NOT UNDER WARRANTY. PLEASE LOOK INTO THIS AND SEE HOW MANY OTHERS HAVE HAD THIS ISSUE. I THINK MB SHOULD HAVE TO FIX THE PROBLEM FOR EVERYONE. THANK YOU.       *JS
